Story.title: Monica: Fairest Of Them All
Story.Description: Monica's been Prom Queen every year since she was a freshman, and to be honest, keeping up appearances is getting totally boring. I mean, the parties, prestige, and eternal popularity are nice, but going through the whole thing again this year? Yawn. Maybe it's time for Monica to do something a little... different.

GoalDescription.words: One date? Too easy. Two dates? It's been done. Three dates? Now we're talking.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Have Monica ###MONICA### date ###DATING### 3 people at once

TidBit.text: Monica is really pulling out all the stops this year.
The journalism students are falling over themselves trying to cover the exciting developments in Monica's love life.
Juggling romantic relationships is proving to be really complicated for Monica. Even more than choosing what to wear for The Prom!
Monica always gets what she wants, no matter how many hearts she has to break along the way.
No one knows the secret to Monica's power of seduction, still - they can't help but submit.

GoalDescription.words: Being popular is hard. It requires suppressing an awful lot of pretty icky desires. The pressure to keep it in might be too much...

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Make Monica ###MONICA### enemies ###ENEMIES### with at least six people

TidBit.text: Monica used to be so nice. OK, maybe not, but at least she used to pretend.
The #MonicaSucks hashtag is skyrocketing in popularity. How many enemeis can she make in one week?!
Monica is racking up the enemies faster than a nerd at a football game.
People are starting to steer clear of Monica in the halls.

GoalDescription.words: One time Monica was assigned a book about some rich prince trading places with some poor guy. She didn't read it, but now she can live it.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Make Monica ###MONICA### have absolutely no friends ###NOT FRIENDS###

TidBit.text: Monica's quickly burning through years of social cred.
For the first time in memory, nobody's talking about Monica.
Yearbook staff just decided to cut the number of Monica-centered pages by 20%. How many bridges can she burn?
A freshman was just overheard saying 'Monica who?' It's the end of an era.
Monica is losing her cachet and fading into the olive-green wallpaper.

GoalDescription.words: Monica and Edward actually used to be pretty good friends. Maybe the new crowd he lurks with isn't as bad as they dress?

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Maintain a friendship ###FRIENDS### between Monica ###MONICA### and Edward ###EDWARD###
Have Monica ###MONICA### become friends ###FRIENDS### with Mave ###MAVE###

TidBit.text: Monica had no idea unpopular kids had feelings too...
Seems Monica is finding out all sorts of things about Goth culture.
Monica is becoming friends with kids who actually ride the *bus* to school!? What is going on!
Next thing you know, Monica's going to stop combing her hair and wearing *black*!

Level.title: Wednesday
Level.Description: Monica was on the way home from school and decided to take the scenic route through the park. Where, lo and behold, she ran into some silly losers - those easiest to sway her way... Or so she thought.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I'll be our MC for tonight, to announce the long awaited - PROM QUEEN!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Yes, Yes... We all know who it is. Just give me the crown!
Thank you, Thank you. I'd like to thank... well, haha, myself - of course!
And my pets at home, Bonnie and Boo Boo - definitely couldn't have done it without them.
Oh! And my beautiful hair... and my make-up and oh! MY MONE-

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Yup, thanks for coming out tonight guys. Enjoy the rest of the night.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey! I'm not done!
I'd really love to dance... I wish someone would dance with me!
Or maybe some punch? So thirsty over here.
Anyone? Anyone at all? Helllllooo? Monica over here!
I guess everybody hates me now.
Maybe I should have been nicer to them...
Someone! Please! Pay attention to me!
Well, I guess I got what I deserved.
All those years of being a selfish queen... when I should have been saying 'Let them eat cake!' like that nice pastry lady from history.
Well, things will change from now on. There will be cake for everyone!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Wow Monica... I never thought I'd say this, but tonight you seem almost... lonely

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: What do *you* care, %r%? So I'm not the Prom Queen this year. Maybe that's what I wanted. Why don't you just leave me alone like everyone else?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Come on Monica, it's not that big of a deal. It's just Prom Queen, who cares about that anyways.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Who *cares* about that!? Are you kidding me! Ugh, I wouldn't expect you guys to understand.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Monica, there's more to life than being popular.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Yeah! Popular kids have to worry about all sorts of stupid things, all the time.
How do you guys even have time for fun!?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You mean... You guys don't worry about how your hair is or what you wear every morning?
Or what people think about you?!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: My *hair*? Are you serious? Have you seen my hair at school?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: No way Monica, we just care about chillin' and being ourselves. Who cares what anybody else thinks. Just relax!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hmmm... Maybe you guys are right. Maybe being yourself is what life is really about!
You know what! I'm done being popular. Enough of these riches and fame!
I'm going to tell my Dad to sell my new sports car and cancel my country club membership tonight!

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Whoa, whoa, whoa, Monica. Let's not be hasty.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Yeah! That country club has a sick swimming pool!

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Hey, so now that we're your friends - can we hang out at your place?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well, I'll have to pull some strings with the front desk, but... okay.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Monica, how are... SWEET JESUS *what* are you wearing?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I know... it's not very Goth. My daddy bought it for me last week... I didn't realize how much my life would change since then.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Tell you what, girl... let's duck out of this thing and head back to my house for a minute. I'll lend you an outfit that'll let the whole school see your new identity.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Really Mave? You'd do that for me?
Even after that time when I flushed your homework down the toilet?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I still owe you for that.
But I'm willing to forgive and forget the past if you are.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Deal. Mave... you're pretty great.
Now let's sneak out and get my new outfit before it's too late.

Instantiation.name: Ending AB: Too Many To Dance With

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I'm so happy to be here at Prom with you, Monica. You're my %sweetie% forever and always.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Mmm, that's nice, %r%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Hey loser, who invited *you* to the Prom.
WHAT?! Sweetie, is this true? You invited us both?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Sure. Both of you and some other people too.
You losers just don't get it. I *own* this school. I have the whole student body wrapped around my little finger. I can do whatever I want.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Well you'll have to do it without me. This is a new low, even for you, Monica.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: If you want to get to the top, %r%, you have to step on a couple faces.
Hey, I have a text. ...Why *yes*, %sweetie%, I *am* free to dance now!
